# RunLoop

**Class**

The programmatic interface to objects that manage input sources.

## Declaration

```swift
class RunLoop
```

## Overview

A [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/RunLoop] object processes input for sources, such as mouse and keyboard events from the window system and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Port] objects. A [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/RunLoop] object also processes [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Timer] events.

Your application neither creates nor explicitly manages [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/RunLoop] objects. The system creates a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/RunLoop] object as needed for each [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Thread] object, including the application’s main thread. If you need to access the current thread’s run loop, use the class method [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/RunLoop/current].

Note that from the perspective of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/RunLoop], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Timer] objects aren’t “input”—they’re a special type, and they don’t cause the run loop to return when they fire.



## Accessing Run Loops and Modes

- **current**: Returns the run loop for the current thread.
- **currentMode**: The receiver’s current input mode.
- **limitDate(forMode:)**: Performs one pass through the run loop in the specified mode and returns the date at which the next timer is scheduled to fire.
- **main**: Returns the run loop of the main thread.
- **getCFRunLoop()**: Returns the receiver’s underlying run loop object.
- **RunLoop.Mode**: Modes that a run loop operates in.

## Managing Timers

- **add(_:forMode:)**: Registers a given timer with a given input mode.

## Managing Ports

- **add(_:forMode:)**: Adds a port as an input source to the specified mode of the run loop.
- **remove(_:forMode:)**: Removes a port from the specified input mode of the run loop.

## Running a Loop

- **run()**: Puts the receiver into a permanent loop, during which time it processes data from all attached input sources.
- **run(mode:before:)**: Runs the loop once, blocking for input in the specified mode until a given date.
- **run(until:)**: Runs the loop until the specified date, during which time it processes data from all attached input sources.
- **acceptInput(forMode:before:)**: Runs the loop once or until the specified date, accepting input only for the specified mode.

## Scheduling and Canceling Tasks

- **perform(_:)**: Schedules a block that the run loop invokes.
- **perform(inModes:block:)**: Schedules a block that the run loop invokes when it’s running in any of the specified modes.
- **perform(_:target:argument:order:modes:)**: Schedules the sending of a message on the receiver.
- **cancelPerform(_:target:argument:)**: Cancels the sending of a previously scheduled message.
- **cancelPerformSelectors(withTarget:)**: Cancels all outstanding ordered performs scheduled with a given target.

## Scheduling Combine Publishers

- **RunLoop.SchedulerTimeType**: The scheduler time type that the run loop uses.
- **RunLoop.SchedulerOptions**: A set of options that affect the operation of the run loop scheduler.

## Default Implementations

- **Scheduler Implementations**

## Run Loop Scheduling

- **Timer**: A timer that fires after a certain time interval has elapsed, sending a specified message to a target object.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
- Scheduler
